attributes.action: suggest to the House of Commons that members refrain from using  the word 'honourable'  as in 'honourable member' in parliamentary speech, so as  to remind members in future of the gross dis service elected members have done to the reputation of the Mother of Parliaments in the first decade of the 21st Century.   Should honourable dealing have returned to the House after the next election, the Prime Minister will suggest that the word be restored to usage.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This petition reflects the strong feelings that are held by many citizens towards the dis-honourable practice prevalent currently in all/most parliamentary parties.
The public removal of the titular word 'honorable' for a duration would remind members in years to come of the purposes for which they were elected, and that serving others requires 'honourable' dealings.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament. http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
